sentences.sentence: Russia warns that Finland's NATO membership has increased the risk of conflict say Moscow might be forced to take retaliatory measures in response Ukraine denies claims by the Russian mercenary group Wagner that it's taken control of the besieged eastern city of Bahamut investigators are focusing on maintenance work that potentially caused

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: a train crash in the Netherlands which killed one person and injured around 30 other passengers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia has warned it might be forced to take retaliatory measures to address what it calls security threats created by Finland's membership of NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The statement from the foreign ministry came after Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said Russia's response would match any build-up on its borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: DIMITRY PESKOV, Kremlin Spokesperson, The Russian Federation We will be watching closely what will happen in Finland, as a block of the North Atlantic will exploit the territory of Finland, in terms of placing weapons, systems, infrastructure, which will potentially threaten us in the vicinity of our borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Depending on this, measures will be taken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu said that Finland's accession to NATO increased the risk of conflict, but would not distract Moscow outcome of the special operation. tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus is set to be completed by July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Residents of the besieged Ukrainian city of Bakhmut loading some of their belongings onto the back of an armoured vehicle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They're being helped by Ukrainian soldiers to leave their homes for a place of safety elsewhere in the country a ghost town the eastern city was once home to some 70,000 people but now tanks and armored vehicles patrol the streets a spokesperson for Ukraine's Eastern Command has denied Russian claims that buckmode has been taken the fight for the city has become the longest and bloodiest battle of Russia's assault on Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Overnight, the head of the private mercenary group Wagner claimed it had raised a Russian

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: flag over an administrative building in Bakhmut. He even posted a night vision video of the act, but the location could not be identified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the Donetsk region, which includes Bakhmut, is especially hot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He is due to visit Poland on Wednesday for talks with his Polish counterpart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Warsaw has already delivered the first batch of Soviet-era MiG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russia claims to have killed up to 285 Ukrainian troops in its Donetsk advance and destroyed Ukrainian military hardware.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The head of the United Nations cultural organization UNESCO was in Ukraine on Monday visiting the city of Chernihiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: According to the institution, 248 monuments have been damaged across Ukraine since Russia's full-scale invasion of the country last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: During a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, Audrey Azoulay made it clear where UNESCO to be on your side, to be on the side of the Ukrainian people, to protect this cultural heritage, to protect education, to protect as much as we can according to our mandate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: UNESCO estimates the damage from the destruction at about 2.4 billion euros and the loss of income in leisure, art and tourism at about 14 billion. Seven cultural sites and one natural site in Ukraine are on UNESCO's World Heritage List including, as of this year, the historic city center of Odessa, which so far has largely spared damage. Azoulay is expected to visit the city on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: spared damage as a lay is expected to visit the city on Tuesday German and Belgian police raided the Brussels headquarters of the European People's Party the EPP is the largest political family in Europe according to a party press release the search was related to an ongoing inquiry in three Gia Germany the parties cooperating in full transparency with the authorities involved, providing all relevant information and documentation, said the press release.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: German media reported that the probe is not directed against the party or any of its current employees, but against Mario Voigt, the CDU leader in Thuringia who is suspected of corruption and bribery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He worked for the EPP during the 2019 electoral cycle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Voigt denies the accusations.

sentences.sentence: De trein was van Leiden naar The Hague, toen het de trein moest aflopen bij de dorp van Voorchotten.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The train was travelling from Leiden to The Hague when it was forced off the tracks near the village of Voorzchotten. As the investigation got underway, the Dutch King, William Alexander, visited the scene after expressing his condolences to the victims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Such accidents in the Netherlands are relatively rare and the country has good record on rail travel safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A strong police presence outside Trump Tower ahead of former U.S. President Donald Trump's appearance in court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He arrived in New York on Monday afternoon, spending the night in his private suite, preparing with his lawyers for today's proceedings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Trump is expected to deny wrongdoing when indicted for his alleged role in hush money payments to porn star Stormy Daniels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He's the first U.S. president in history to face a criminal case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There's tight security in New York as the city braces for potential street protests by both his supporters and detractors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The New York Police Department is on high alert ahead of the arraignment, ordering its 36,000 officers to be in uniform and ready to deploy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Our message is clear and simple. ordering its 36,000 officers to be in uniform and ready to deploy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Our message is clear and simple. Control yourselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: New York City is our home, not a playground for your misplaced anger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are the safest large city in America because we respect the rule of law in New York City.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The exact charges to be leveled against Trump are unknown, but his lawyers have said he will plead not guilty. The payment to Stormy Daniels was not illegal, but he allegedly recorded it as a business expense. Falsifying business records is illegal in New York. The former president is expected to return to his Florida home after the court releases him on bail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization is warning that infertility is a major health problem in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: About one in six of the adult population is affected, a new report published on Tuesday says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And while the report doesn't look at the causes of infertility, it provides a detailed overview of its prevalence by analysing all relevant studies since 1990.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The infertility has not had much attention globally and this is largely because there has been in the population discussions there has been much more of a focus on contraception rather than infertility and so it is it just has not been prioritized. Solutions such as assisted reproduction remain underfunded and inaccessible to many due to high costs and social stigma, the report says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It also highlights a lack of data in many countries, particularly in Africa, the Eastern Mediterranean and Southeast Asia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: These are the scenes of devastation across parts of the U.S.'s South and Midwest following Friday's deadly tornadoes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And now, as residents sift through the wreckage of their homes, forecasters are warning of more severe weather in the days ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The fierce storms that spawned the tornadoes, killing at least 32 people, were caused by a combination of low pressure and strong winds. Forecasters say those same conditions are now set to return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit, which designs rockets for launching small satellites, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The move comes after the company announced last week that it was laying off 675 employees, or 85 per cent of the workforce.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Its 21-metre rocket, launched from a Boeing 747 off the coast of Cornwall in the UK failed to reach orbit in early January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The first stamps featuring the profile of Britain's King Charles III rolling off the printing press. Officially, they're due to go on sale at post offices and retailers from today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But, like Charles, who had to wait a long time before succeeding Queen Elizabeth II on the throne, it may be a while before you receive a letter with one on it. Stockists will not be selling them until all the stamps featuring his mother's image have been used up. The format for the stamp is the same as the first one, featuring Queen Victoria in 1840, except that Charles is not seen wearing a crown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The coffin of one of Egypt's longest ruling pharaohs, Ramesses II,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: been taken out of its protective packaging.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It is to be the star attraction at an exhibition in Paris of 180 original pieces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The loan of the empty sarcophagus to France is exceptional.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's the first time in close to 50 years that the almost 3,000-year-old relic has travelled out of Egypt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Also on display will be jewellery, statues, amulets, masks and other coffins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ramesses the Great and the Gold of the Pharaohs runs at La Villette from 7 April to 6 September.
